title: Care Worker
qualifications_required: Formal training or certification in care assistance
experience_required: Experience in providing personal care and support to individuals
description:
Care Worker - Band 4

We are currently seeking a compassionate and dedicated Care Worker to join our team. As a Care Worker, you will provide personal care, practical support, and emotional assistance to individuals in their homes or in residential care settings. Your role will involve assisting with daily living activities, providing companionship, and monitoring a person's condition.

Reporting to the Care Manager, your key responsibilities will include assisting with personal hygiene, dressing, and eating, as well as providing emotional support and companionship. You will also be responsible for household tasks and medication administration, ensuring the safety and well-being of our clients.

Candidate Requirements:

  • Experience in providing personal care and support to individuals
  • Ability to assist with daily living activities, such as personal hygiene, dressing, and eating
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to provide emotional support and companionship
  • Basic knowledge of household tasks and medication administration

Benefits:

  • Competitive salary based on Band 4
  • Full-time, permanent contract
  • Location: various locations in the UK

title: Senior Carer
qualifications_required: NVQ Level 3 in Health and Social Care or equivalent qualification
experience_required: Previous experience working as a care assistant or senior carer in a care home setting
description:
The Senior Carer is a vital role within our care home, responsible for providing high-quality care and support to our residents. As a Senior Carer, you will lead and supervise a team of care assistants, ensuring that all care is delivered in a person-centered and compassionate manner. Your role will involve care planning, medication administration, and promoting the wellbeing and independence of our residents. You will work collaboratively with other healthcare professionals and maintain accurate records of care provided. This is a Band 5 position with a salary of ÃÂÃÂ£25,000-ÃÂÃÂ£30,000 per year, depending on experience.

As a Senior Carer, you will report to the Care Home Manager and work closely with the care team to ensure the highest standard of care is provided to our residents. You will also be responsible for training and mentoring care staff, as well as handling challenging situations in a care home setting. You must have previous experience working as a care assistant or senior carer in a care home setting and hold a NVQ Level 3 in Health and Social Care or equivalent qualification. Excellent communication and leadership skills are essential for this role, as well as the ability to work independently and as part of a team. Experience in care planning and medication administration is also required.

To be considered for this role, you must have previous experience working in a care home setting and hold a NVQ Level 3 in Health and Social Care or equivalent qualification. You must also possess excellent communication and leadership skills, as well as the ability to work independently and as part of a team. Experience in care planning and medication administration is essential for this role. Desirable criteria include experience in training and mentoring care staff, as well as working with elderly or vulnerable individuals.

  • Competitive salary of ÃÂÃÂ£25,000-ÃÂÃÂ£30,000 per year
  • Full-time, permanent position
  • Located in a care home setting

title: Marketing Executive
experience_required: Experience in developing and implementing marketing strategies, project management skills, analytical and problem-solving abilities, experience in content creation and management, strong understanding of social media platforms and their analytics
description:
The Marketing Executive will be responsible for establishing the company as a thought leader in the industry, growing public awareness of the company, and communicating the company's mission and values to the public. They will develop and implement a marketing strategy, manage the day-to-day operations of the company's marketing department, and oversee marketing campaigns. The Marketing Executive will report to the Marketing Manager.

The key responsibilities of the Marketing Executive include developing the department's marketing calendar, workflows, and content team's "course of action". They will also analyze various types of data to build content strategies and review each piece of content before it goes live to ensure it meets quality standards and is error-free. The Marketing Executive will also promote content and track and measure its performance.

The ideal candidate for this role will have experience in developing and implementing marketing strategies, strong project management skills, and excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities. They should also have experience in content creation and management and a strong understanding of social media platforms and their analytics. Desirable criteria include experience in the same or similar industry, experience in managing a team, knowledge of SEO and digital marketing techniques, and experience in data analysis and reporting.

  • Competitive salary (Band 5)
  • Full-time, permanent contract
  • Located in the UK

title: Care Team Coordinator
experience_required: Previous experience in a similar role
description:
The Care Team Coordinator will be responsible for coordinating scheduling for care staff, supervising care plans and ensuring compliance, serving as the main point of contact between clients and staff, and updating digital care logs and managing staff documentation. This role falls under SOC Code 3219 and has a salary band of £25,000 – £28,000.

Key responsibilities of this role include coordinating schedules and managing staff, ensuring compliance with care industry regulations and standards, handling difficult client-staff interactions, and effectively managing time and workload. The Care Team Coordinator will report to the hiring manager and serve as the main point of contact between clients and staff.

The ideal candidate for this role must have excellent organizational and time management skills, as well as strong communication and interpersonal skills. Previous experience in a similar role and knowledge of care industry regulations and standards are desirable criteria.

  • Competitive salary band of £25,000 – £28,000
  • Opportunity to work in a fast-paced and rewarding environment
  • Chance to develop and utilize skills in coordinating schedules and managing staff
